main event: A bright, flashing light was observed by ground radar near Cato, New York on September 31, 1962.
interesting points: The object was confirmed on air traffic control radar.
The object was partially obscured by clouds.
The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes.
The object appeared to be a satellite, though the report could not be fully evaluated due to lack of certain identifying information.
Other similar sightings were reported in the area around the same time.
witnesses: confirmed by air traffic control radar
